nodes.bodyText: wonder if we should call super.setGenerateXtendStub too
I don't think it is required. JUnitFragment no more uses the generateXtendStub from the superclass.

This field here smells like a hack.
Can we instead call setGenerateXtendStub(false) from our constructor and use the BooleanGenOption from the super class?

 import org.eclipse.xtext.xtext.generator.model.TypeReference
+import org.eclipse.xtext.xtext.generator.util.BooleanGeneratorOption
 
 import static extension org.eclipse.xtext.GrammarUtil.*
 
 /**
  * @since 2.14
  */
 class JUnitFragment extends AbstractStubGeneratingFragment {
-

 	@Inject extension XtextGeneratorNaming
 	@Inject FileAccessFactory fileAccessFactory
-

-	def void setJunitVersion (String version) {
-		junitVersion = JUnitVersion.fromString(version)
+	final BooleanGeneratorOption generateXtendStub = new BooleanGeneratorOption(true);

nodes.bodyText: No, please don't go down that path. IterableExtensions.join(..) is a good fit here.
